abstract: Health and Human Services Dept announces that premiums for midlevel health plans under Affordable Care Act will rise by average of 25 percent in 2017, and that customers in some states will have fewer insurance plans to choose from; increase in premium rates in 2015 was 2 percent, and 7 percent in 2016; rising prices and shrinking options essentially ensure next president will have to make significant improvements to law.

headline.print_headline: Choices Fall in Health Law as Costs Rise
headline.main: Some Health Plan Costs to Increase by an Average of 25 Percent, U.S. Says

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Consumers in some states will also find significantly fewer insurance companies offering coverage under the Affordable Care Act....
lead_paragraph: Consumers in some states will also find significantly fewer insurance companies offering coverage under the Affordable Care Act.
